column12: TREATING NEUROPATHIC PAIN IN SPINAL CORD INJURED INDIVIDUALS
column13: Methods of treating neuropathic pain in spinal cord injured individuals by administering levetiracetam or brivaracetam are described.

column12: TREATING NEUROPATHIC PAIN IN SPINAL CORD INJURED INDIVIDUALS
column13: Methods of treating neuropathic pain in spinal cord injured individuals by administering levetiracetam or brivaracetam are described.
column32: NB FINNERUP 等: "Levetiracetam in spinal cord injury pain: a randomized controlled trial", 《SPINAL CORD》

column12: Treating neuropathic pain in spinal cord injured individuals
column13: Methods of treating neuropathic pain in spinal cord injured individuals by administering levetiracetam or brivaracetam are described.

column12: METHOD AND DEVICE FOR TENTING DURA MATER IN SPINAL SURGERY
column13: Disclosed herein is a method, device, and kit for tenting dura mater. In one embodiment, the device is implanted to elevate the dura mater above the spinal cord to prevent or reduce scar tissue. The kit can include a dura mater tenting device and instructions for elevating a dura mater surface above the spinal cord.

column12: Method for eradicating pain of central origin resulting from spinal cord injury
column13: Methods are provided to reliably identify and surgically eradicate aberrant DREZ in patients suffering from spinal cord injury. The methods include identifying potential aberrant DREZ using a combination of mapping techniques based on the location of the patients perceived pain, analysis of the spontaneous electrical hyperactivity in targeted DREZ, and analysis of evoked transcutaneous C-fiber stimulation both in pre-operative and operative conditions. Methods are also provided for identifying potential pain effecters in aberrant DREZ, useful in the preparation of non-invasive therapeutics for central pain characteristic of spinal cord injury.

column12: Rodent model of central neuropathic pain
column13: The present disclosure describes an animal model of central neuropathic pain relevant to spinal cord injury, as well as methods of using the model to screen for therapeutic agents and to test existing therapies.

column12: METHOD FOR ERADICATING PAIN OF CENTRAL ORIGIN RESULTING FROM SPINAL CORD INJURY
column13: Methods are provided to reliably identify and surgically eradicate aberrant DREZ in patients suffering from spinal cord injury. The methods include identifying potential aberrant DREZ using a combination of mapping techniques based on the location of the patients perceived pain, analysis of the spontaneous electrical hyperactivity in targeted DREZ, and analysis of evoked transcutaneous C-fiber stimulation both in pre-operative and operative conditions. Methods are also provided for identifying potential pain effecters in aberrant DREZ, useful in the preparation of non-invasive therapeutics for central pain characteristic of spinal cord injury.

The methods include identifying potential aberrant DREZ using a combination of mapping techniques based on the location of the patients perceived pain, analysis of the spontaneous electrical hyperactivity in targeted DREZ, and analysis of evoked transcutaneous C-fiber stimulation both in pre-operative and operative conditions. Methods are also provided for identifying potential pain effecters in aberrant DREZ, useful in the preparation of non-invasive therapeutics for central pain characteristic of spinal cord injury.

column12: ANIMAL MODEL OF CENTRAL NEUROPATHIC PAIN AND METHODS OF MAKING AND USING THE SAME
column13: The present disclosure describes an animal model of central neuropathic pain relevant to spinal cord injury, as well as methods of using the model to screen for therapeutic agents and to test existing therapies.
column32: YEZIERSKI: "Spinal Cord Injury: A Model of Central Neuropathic Pain", NEUROSIGNALS, vol. 14, no. 4, October 2005 (2005-10-01), pages 182 - 193, XP008135862

column12: TREATING NEUROPATHIC PAIN IN SPINAL CORD INJURED INDIVIDUALS
column13: Methods of treating neuropathic pain in spinal cord injured individuals by administering levetiracetam or brivaracetam are described.
column32: Finnerup Levetiracetam in spinal cord injury pain a randomized controlled trial, Spinal Cord, 2009, Vol. 47, pp 861-867;;Siddal et al The efficacy of intrathecal morphine and clonidine in the treatment of pain after spinal cord injury, Anesth. Analg. 2000, Vol. 91, pp 1493-1498

column12: Water and color retention treatment for frozen processed shrimp
column13: In a process for treating shrimp that comprises (a) soaking whole, peeled and deveined shrimp in an aqueous solution containing at least one phosphate salt; and (b) thereafter freezing said soaked shrimp to preserve the shrimp for later cooking and consumption; wherein the improvement comprises carrying out sait soaking step for sufficient time and in the presence of an effective amount of a trace metal salt selected from the group consisting of calcium salts, magnesium salts, and mixtures thereof, in order to substantially maintain the trace metal content in said shrimp, whereby said treated shrimp will have white tissue coloration and a natural tender texture after cooking.
column32: Gordon, A., Journal of Food Manufacturing, Jul. 1971, pp. 57, 58.;;Mathgn, C., Fishery Technology, 5, 1968, pp. 104-112.;;Ellinger, R. H., "Phosphates as Food Ingredients", CRC Press, pp. 131-145, 1972.;;Gibson, D. M. et al., Journal of Food Technology, 8, 1973, pp. 197-204.
